dialog: Of course, here is my passport.
I take it you are here for the German delegation's business, correct?
Indeed, I was invited by a German company for some business discussions.
For how long will you be residing in our fair land?
Just for two weeks, nothing too long.
How many pieces of luggage have you brought with you?
Just one, my trusty camera.
Do you have plans to remove it upon your departure?
I do, indeed.
Per the regulations, your camera is allowed to stay with you during your time here duty-free, but it must be removed upon leaving our country.
I shall comply with these regulations.
Well then, may your stay in Germany be filled with pleasant experiences.
My thanks to you.
Excuse me, what should I include in my Curriculum Vitae?
Typically, a CV or resume should include six elements: personal information, educational background, practical experience, personal skills, self-evaluation, and career aspirations.
What kind of personal information is required?
Such information as your name, gender, date of birth, height, and contact information, among others.
May I enter?
Indeed, come in. I am the Director of Personnel, Mr. Peter. How may I assist you?
It is a pleasure to meet you, Mr. Peter. I am Wang Sian, and I am here for the interview as previously arranged.
